wikipedia_page.main: Arthur Booth (8 January 1926 – September 2004) was an English cricketer active from 1949 to 1952 who played for Lancashire. He was born in Droylsden, Lancashire and died in Dobcross, Lancashire. He appeared in four first-class matches as a righthanded batsman, scoring 81 runs with a highest score of 49 and held one catch.In 1950 he scored 253 for Lancashire Second XI against Lincolnshire in the Minor Counties Championship.
